page.title: 05H O M E L I F E
page.content: Home produced vegetables,cream and milk are available at the farm shop, and groceries and frozen foods at the general stores. Many housewives freeze their own fresh vegetables and fruit ready for winter use, storing them in deep freezers. Cooking is done with either solid fuel, gas, electric or oil fired cookers. Every household has mains water supplied by the Water Board and electricity by the Electricity Board. These are paid for by a quarterly account. Each house has its own sanitation system _ mostly septic tank drainage. The nearest school is 3 miles away, and a bus collects the children. There is a mobile library which serves the area. The car is a necessary mode of transport.
